oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Your Goodwill Station, WVOL Radio

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Large broadside advertising WVOL Radio station in Nashville, Tennessee. Included on the print are the names and images of the WVOL radio personalities from the late 1950s.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides; Radio Stations; Radio broadcasting
Broadsides; Radio stations
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: WVOL
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In 1951, WVOL operated as WSOK under the ownership of Cal Young. It was located on 4th Avenue North in Nashville, where the Nashville Municipal Auditorium is now. In 1957, R. W. Rounsaville purchased WSOK and the call letters were changed to WVOL. Oprah Winfrey started her broadcasting career at WVOL.
